definition[0]: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing
example[1]: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
example[2]: This painting is typical of his work.
example[3]: On a typical day, our students go to classes from 7.30 am to 1 pm.
example[4]: Try calculating your budget for a typical week.
definition[2]: behaving in the way that you expect
example[5]: Bennett accepted the award with typical modesty.
example[6]: Mr Stevens’ appointment was a typical case of promoting a man beyond his level of competence.
example[7]: It’s not typical of Gill to be so critical.
note[1]: it is typical of somebody to do something
definition[3]: a typical person or thing is a good example of that type of person or thing
example[8]: With his camera around his neck, he looked like a typical tourist.
example[9]: The windows are typical of houses built during this period.
definition[4]: used to describe a very typical and very good example of something
example[10]: It was a classic case of the cure being worse than the disease.
example[12]: The book is a classic example of great teamwork.
definition[5]: the archetypal  person or thing is the most typical example of that kind of person or thing, and has all their most important qualities
example[14]: Indiana Jones is the archetypal adventure hero.
definition[6]: used when you want to emphasize that someone or something is the very best example of something – used especially when you admire them very much
example[15]: the quintessential guide to New York
example[16]: Robert Plant is the quintessential rock ‘n’ roll singer.
definition[7]: having the characteristics that many people believe a particular type of person or thing has – used when you think these beliefs are not true
example[17]: Hollywood films are full of stereotypical images of women as wives and mothers.
example[18]: He challenges stereotypical ideas about people with disabilities.
definition[8]: containing the most common types of people or things that are found in something, and showing what it is usually like
example[19]: a representative sample of college students
definition[9]: very typical of a particular type of thing, or of someone’s character or usual behaviour
example[20]: Each species of bird has its own characteristic song.
example[21]: What gives Paris its characteristic charm?
example[22]: He played with his characteristic skill.
example[23]: the characteristic symptoms of the disease
definition[10]: to be the best possible example of a particular type of person or thing or of a particular quality
example[24]: His house was thought to be the epitome of good taste.
definition[11]: used to show that you are annoyed when something bad happens again, or when someone does something bad again
